title.narrative: 602 PUBLIC FINANCE FOR CHILDREN

description.narrative: Key decision makers at national and sub-national levels in UNICEF programming states have enhanced capacities to apply a child and adolescent focused lens and establish monitoring and tracking expenditure with emphasis on two critical stages of lifecycle in budgeting cycle by 2022., which contributes to Reducing Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Social policies and strategies inform more effective and efficient planning, budgeting and implementation of social service programmes for reducing inequities and gender inequalities especially for the most vulnerable and marginalized children and adolescents by 2022

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Key decision makers at national and sub-national levels in UNICEF programming states have enhanced capacities to apply a child andadolescent focused lens and establish monitoring and tracking expenditure with emphasis on two critical stages of lifecycle inbudgeting cycle by 2022.

description.narrative: Policy advocacy based on rigorous analysis and technical support assistance from UNICEF led to institutionalization of child budgets in 3 more states- West Bengal, Chhattisgarh and Assam; initiation of outcome budgets in Madhya Pradesh & Jharkhand and SDG & Nutrition Budgets in ODISHA. UNICEF’s advocacy towards ring fencing budgetary resources for children during the outbreak of COVID 19 resulted in increase in resources for children in the post COVID period. Growth of PC expenditure on children is higher in the post- COVID period for Bihar, Rajasthan, Gujarat & UP despite decline in share of child spending in 2021-22. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:04/01/2022
